messages.title: Tackling burglary and violent crime
messages.content: The resources for Nottingham have been reduced significantly in recent years and too many offences go unpunished. "Anti-social behaviour can really blight a neighbourhood and we need to take more risk serious," says Chris. More police forces on the beat must be a priority.

messages.title: A passion for educational excellence
messages.content: "High quality schools with good resources and excellent teaching should be our goal for every child" says Chris Leslie. He fervently opposes the proposed cuts in the Conservative budget changes.

messages.title: Time to save the NHS
messages.content: If we lose the NHS as we know it, we may never get it back. The pressures on Nottingham's GPs and our local hospitals are greater than ever. Elderly and disabled people are having their social care cut back. The Tory Conservative are heading toward 18 months of dedicated resistance to undermining the founding principle of taxpayers coming together.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Defend the NHS and the principle of the 18-week maximum waiting target. Campaign for the NHS to be properly funded avoiding hospital trust deficits.
Fight for school standards and oppose group changing the Tory funding formula, protecting Nottingham schools with cuts of over £500 per pupil.
Champion jobs and living standards boost productivity and investment to bring white safeguarding financial stability and taxpayers' money.
Fight for Britain to keep the European links that have benefited Nottingham since the UK joined the 'common market'. Keep Nottingham East's voice strong in Parliament during Brexit negotiations.

mentions.tacticalSituation: This election could be the closest in Nottingham East for decades. With the Tories banking on a big nationwide lead, re-electing Chris Leslie is more important than ever.
